```{r}
# N represents number of coinflips
N<-200
```

```{r}
#method sample takes a vector meaning values that can be chosen from, N representing the amount of times to sample. and Replace = true, means to sample with replacement
y<-sample(c(0,1),N,replace=TRUE)
print(y)
```

```{r}
# Adds all previous values up in the list
z<-cumsum(y)

#Acts as array in java, can access values directly
print(z[200])
```

```{r}
plot(z)
```

```{r}
Gs<-0
```

```{r}
M<-100
```

```{r}
for (j in 1:M){
  
  y<-sample(c(0,1),N,replace=TRUE)
  z<-cumsum(y) 
  
  
  
  Gs[j]<-z[N]
}

```

```{r}
#breaks represents that size of each "bin" for this 
hist(Gs,breaks=M/20)
```
